intro: Cyrtandra woodsii, commonly known as the Hawaiian skyflower, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its striking, showy blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, elliptic to ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. Cyrtandra woodsii thrives in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing nectar for native pollinators.
